Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: EGN 3331C and CGN 3405 both with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced mechanics of materials applied to civil structural systems, elasticity, torsion, inelastic bending, failure theory for concrete and soils, compatibility, equilibrium, and energy methods.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

CES4100C - Structural Analysis I and Lab.name: CES4100C - Structural Analysis I and Lab

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAP 2302, EGN 3331C and CGN 3405, all with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Topics in structural mechanics, analysis of determinate and indeterminate structures by flexibility and stiffness methods computer and laboratory exercises on behavior of structures and materials.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CES 4100C with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design of RC members using ACI code; beam flexure and shear; compression bending; bond and development; introduction to continuous frames.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CES 4100C with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design of structural steel members and buildings; emphasis on AISC-ASD building code; introduction to AISC-LRFD building code; tension and compression members, beams, beam-columns, connections.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CES 4605 and CES 4702 both with grade of "C" (2.0) or better and department consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course prepares students for real life structural design with the fundamentals and applications of both steel and concrete analysis and design at the member and system level.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science
